ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend the course to any student of literature or history. The readings, discussions, assignments were all good.
I would. For students of basically any department, too. It's a great introduction to things that any student should know - and that impression is the sign of a great course.
A study of the cultural development of Modernity through literature in the 19th century. An excellent course.
I would wholeheartedly recommend this course to another student.

It feels a somewhat more like a French class than a CompLit class - although its interdisciplinary nature does mean it is useful to CompLit students, even if the focus of the class is on one country's literature. I would recommend it to anyone who is seeking to get a good overview of the preoccupations of many of the great novelists of 19th century France, and who is looking for an exploration of some of the prominent theorists of modernity.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: All the texts we read were important and part of the canon, so definitely well worth the time spent with them!
